alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:09AM EST until December 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CARROLL, SOUTHEASTERN COOS AND EASTERN GRAFTON COUNTIES... At 909 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Rapid snowmelt and frozen soils will contribute to the runoff. The hilly terrain will favor fast flowing water which will overwhelm small streams and culverts. Small stream rises are expected through the afternoon, with additional flash flood warnings likely. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain and snowmelt. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding will likely lead to road washouts in the warned area. Travel will become increasingly hazardous in the region. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The White Mountains Region including the towns of Conway, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Moultonborough, Ossipee, Plymouth, Holderness, Ashland, Effingham and Franconia. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
